div.head: M. G. In commendation of the worke.

lg.l: SVch sugred sappe, such dewe of sweete delight,
As painefull Bees that bide on Hibla hill:
From fragrante floures both fresh and faire in sight.
With laboure greate, do galne their hiues to fill.
Such, and no more, the well disposed minde:
Within this booke, by reading soone may finde.
Then praise the wight, whose paines shal please th√©e so,
And please thy selfe with that which profite bringes:
And with thy profite, profite many moe,
And then reporte by proofe what profite springes
From our (Greene Youth) and safelie say thou this:
Such witte doth wante in grauer heads then his.
